title: Facebook will pay $650 million to settle class action suit centered on Illinois privacy law
text: Facebook was ordered to pay $650 million Friday for running afoul of an Illinois law designed to protect the state's residents from invasive privacy practices. That law, the Biometric Information Privacy Act (BIPA), is a powerful state measure that's tripped up tech companies in recent years.

title: SOS Ltd: Buy the Bounce or Run Like Hell?
text: On Friday, SOS stock dropped 25% as short-sellers Hindenburg Research and Culper targeted the company. What should investors do next?

title: Facebook: How It Forced Me To Face The Truth
text: Over the last six months, Facebook shares have underperformed the S&P 500 by a wide margin. The introduction of iOS 14 and a variety of government sanctions and suits cause some to shun the stock.

title: Facebook Unveils Bars, A TikTok-Style App For Aspiring Rappers
text: Facebook, Inc.'s (NASDAQ: FB) New Product Experimentation, a research and development group, has unveiled Bars, an app that enables users to create their own rap mini-videos. What Happened: Bars provides professionally created beats for users, who then add their own lyrics and record themselves.

title: 9 Tech Stocks To Invest in From the Bargain Bin
text: Most tech stocks have fallen out of favor recently as investors seek value over growth. The post 9 Tech Stocks To Invest in From the Bargain Bin appeared first on InvestorPlace.

title: After Australia row, Facebook signs up partners for German news product
text: Facebook said on Monday it had signed up a string of German media partners to provide content for a local news product, in a success for the U.S. social network following a row over payment for news content in Australia.

title: February Ends in Green Amid Extreme Volatility: 5 Top Picks
text: We have narrowed down our search to five corporate behemoths that suffered a blow in last month's turmoil. These are AAPL, MSFT, FB, ABT and DHR.
